title: Paul Gustard interview: How England can beat Australia and why playing like Saracens can lead to eventual World Cup glory
text:
If anyone knows how to plot Australia’s downfall in the World Cup quarter-final in Oita on Saturday, it is Paul Gustard.

The former England defence coach helped mastermind five successive victories over the Wallabies as part of Eddie Jones’ original coaching triumvirate, which presided over a world record-equalling winning streak of 18 Test victories.

One of his favourite victories remains England’s famous second Test victory over the Wallabies in Melbourne, which clinched a first series victory on Australian soil with a 23-7 win thanks to a heroic defensive performance, when the tourists prevailed despite enjoying just 30 per cent of possession and were tasked with making 230 tackles to just...
description: If anyone knows how to plot Australia’s downfall in the World Cup quarter-final in Oita on Saturday, it is Paul Gustard.
